item.description:
@Scully wrote:

On another topic

yeah it’s completely fudgeed, try this instead (wip) https://bitbucket.org/eggsampler/rsc/src/6ea0b04e22fadaa293d6dacf5ec357c4da9aedab/204/?at=master

Yeah that one seems much better in terms of less fudgeed up issues. Only thing I see at the moment is Friend’s list uses ‘=’ instead of ’ '. That’s fine though. Time to redo all of my edits…

I’m in the process of trying to lay it out similar to RS3’s Legacy mode and OSRS resizable mode. I’ve never really messed with RSC stuff before so it’s pretty fun.

item.title: Client 234
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

i used mgi125’s class trasnformer v3 and fernflower with the following class to produce this
[spoiler]
java -cp fernflower.jar;. de.fernflower.main.decompiler.ConsoleDecompiler -ren=1 -urc=com.Rename deobed_cleaned_rsclassic.jar decompiled

package com;

import de.fernflower.main.extern.IIdentifierRenamer;

public class Rename implements IIdentifierRenamer {
  
  private static int countClass = 0;
  private static int countField = 0;
  private static int countMethod = 0;
  
  public boolean toBeRenamed(int elementType, String className, String element, String descriptor) {
    if(elementType == IIdentifierRenamer.ELEMENT_CLASS) {
      return !className.equals("client");
    }
    
    if(elementType == IIdentifierRenamer.ELEMENT_FIELD || elementType == IIdentifierRenamer.ELEMENT_METHOD) {
      return element.length() < 3;
    }
    
    return false;
  }

  public String getNextClassname(String fullName, String shortName) {
    System.out.println(fullName + " " + shortName);
    return "class" + (countClass++);
  }

  public String getNextFieldname(String className, String field, String descriptor) {
    System.out.println(className + "  field " + field + " " + descriptor);
    return "field" + (countField++);
  }

  public String getNextMethodname(String className, String method, String descriptor) {
    System.out.println(className + " method " + method + " " + descriptor);
    return "method" + (countMethod++);
  }

}

[/spoiler]

applied some basic fixes to get it to compile

  • crashes on startup due to not being able to download caches
  • added a class to launch the game as an applet, uses cache from codebase like the regular client would do

to do

  • ???

works but some of the walls seem odd

Read full topic
